scenario: Patti tracks throughput and staffing in spreadsheets and wants Python/R to clean data, visualize bottlenecks, and present findings to leadership while managing shifts and family commitments.
expectations: Accessibility for long work shifts and family commitments
Templates and checklists to apply immediately at work

phases.title: Awareness
actions: Gets recommendation from a colleague who took a coding course
Reads an article on using R for healthcare quality improvement
Visits NC State page and downloads the syllabus PDF
pains: Intimidated by coding syntax and error messages
Worried about math requirements and prior stat knowledge
Unsure if laptop meets software requirements

feelings.quote: Can someone like me actually learn to code without a CS background?

opportunities: Highlight 'no prior coding required' with a clear learning path
Provide minimum hardware specs and a compatibility check
Show a 3-minute video demystifying code cells and scripts

phases.title: Consideration
actions: Compares NC State with a MOOC and a local bootcamp
Emails program staff about workload and instructor support
Reviews sample datasets relevant to healthcare ops
pains: Needs clarity on recorded sessions and make-up options
Wants assurance of practical relevance to healthcare

feelings.quote: If it's flexible and clearly applicable to my unit, I'm in.

opportunities: List all costs up front and emphasize open-source tooling
Publish a make-up/recordings policy and turnaround times
Include a healthcare mini-project example (wait-time analysis)

phases.title: Enrollment
actions: Uses employer reimbursement form and enrolls
Completes orientation module and community intro
Runs a guided install for RStudio and Jupyter
pains: Nervous about posting first message in the forum
Install hiccups due to hospital IT restrictions
Scheduling uncertainty due to shift changes

feelings.quote: I hope I can keep up even when my shifts change.

opportunities: Offer low-friction intros (prompted template for first post)
Provide portable, IT-friendly options (Docker or cloud notebooks)

phases.title: Engagement
actions: Builds a dashboard for unit throughput and staffing
Schedules office hours for feedback on visualization choices
pains: Interpreting regression outputs and confidence intervals
Balancing learning with fatigue after long shifts
